title: Edwardian Expressions
description: Explore the elegant language of the Edwardian era (1901-1910) and its social customs

questions.question: In Edwardian England, what was a 'motor car' commonly called by skeptics?
What was an Edwardian 'at home' day?
options: A designated day when a lady received visitors

questions.question: In Edwardian society, what did 'to come out' mean for a young woman?
options: To be formally introduced to society as a debutante

questions.question: What was a 'suffragette' in the Edwardian era?
options: A woman who campaigned for the right to vote

questions.question: In Edwardian parlance, what was a 'picture palace'?
options: An early cinema or movie theater

questions.question: What did 'the Season' refer to in Edwardian high society?
options: The annual series of elite social events in London

questions.question: In Edwardian England, what was a 'chaperone'?
options: An older person accompanying a young unmarried woman in public

questions.question: What was a 'Gibson Girl' in the Edwardian era?
options: The ideal of fashionable femininity illustrated by Charles Dana Gibson

questions.question: In Edwardian vocabulary, what was a 'morning call'?
options: A formal afternoon social visit despite the name

questions.question: What did 'cut direct' mean in Edwardian society?
options: A deliberate public snub by refusing to acknowledge someone

questions.question: In the Edwardian era, what was a 'tea gown'?
options: An informal dress worn by women at home during afternoon tea

questions.question: What was an Edwardian 'house party'?
options: An extended weekend stay at a country estate with entertainment

questions.question: In Edwardian slang, what did 'topping' mean?
What was a 'card tray' used for in an Edwardian household?
options: Collecting visitors' calling cards in the entrance hall
